title: What is NPM?

options.b: Node Package Manager

title: What is the primary purpose of NPM?

options.a: To manage packages and dependencies for Node.js applications
options.b: To create web applications

title: Which programming language is commonly associated with NPM?

options.b: Python

title: What is a 'package' in NPM?

options.a: A present you receive on your birthday
options.b: A collection of files, usually containing code and a package.json file

title: In NPM, what is the 'package.json' file?

options.a: A JSON file that contains metadata about a package
options.b: A configuration file for NPM itself
options.d: A file that stores JavaScript code

title: What is the 'node_modules' directory in an NPM project?

options.b: A directory where NPM stores installed packages and their dependencies
options.c: A directory for web page layouts

title: What does the 'npm install' command do?

options.b: To update NPM to the latest version
options.c: To install dependencies for a Node.js project

title: In NPM, what is a 'global' package?

options.b: A package installed globally on the system rather than in a specific project
options.c: A package used for sending international messages

title: What is the purpose of 'npm init'?

options.a: To initialize a new NPM project and generate a package.json file
options.b: To install all available packages

title: In NPM, what is 'semantic versioning' (semver)?

options.a: A way to write code using semantic language
options.b: A versioning scheme for software that uses three numbers separated by dots (e.g., 1.2.3)
options.d: A method for sending messages between applications

title: What is the purpose of 'npm outdated'?

options.a: To check for outdated packages and list them
options.b: To update NPM
options.c: To create a new package.json file

title: What is 'npm update' used for?

options.a: To upgrade all packages to their latest versions
options.b: To uninstall packages
options.c: To create a new package.json file

title: What is the 'npm publish' command used for?

options.b: To create a new NPM package and publish it to the registry
options.d: To upload images to a server

title: What is the 'npm search' command used for?

options.b: To search for available NPM packages

title: What is the 'npm uninstall' command used for?

options.b: To uninstall a package

title: What is 'npm link' used for?

options.a: To create a hyperlink in a web page
options.b: To link a global package to a local project
options.c: To link to a social media profile
options.d: To send a link in an email

title: In NPM, what is a 'script' in the 'package.json' file used for?

options.b: To define custom commands for running tasks in your project

title: What does 'npm audit' do?

options.b: To check for security vulnerabilities in your project's dependencies

title: What is the purpose of 'npm doctor'?

options.b: To diagnose and automatically fix common issues in your NPM project
options.c: To find a doctor's contact information

title: What is 'npx' in the context of NPM?

options.b: A package manager
options.c: A tool that comes with NPM to execute binaries from packages

title: What does 'npm run' do?

options.b: To run a marathon
options.c: To execute a script specified in the 'package.json' file

title: What is 'npm outdated' used for?

options.b: To check for outdated packages and list them
options.d: To check for spelling errors in code

title: What is 'npm cache' used for?

options.b: To clear or manage the NPM cache

title: What is 'npm ls' used for?

options.b: To list the installed packages in your project
options.c: To list the latest sports scores

title: What is the 'npm update' command used for?

options.a: To upgrade packages to their latest versions
options.b: To update your operating system

title: What is the purpose of 'npm prune'?

options.a: To remove dead branches from a tree
options.b: To remove unused packages from your 'node_modules' directory
options.c: To prune roses in a garden
options.d: To prune code in a project

title: What does 'npm dedupe' do?

options.b: To deduplicate dependencies in the 'node_modules' directory
options.c: To deduplicate files in a folder

title: What is 'npm access' used for?

options.b: To access a secure building
options.c: To manage access control for packages

title: What does 'npm login' do?

options.a: To log in to a computer
options.b: To log in to an NPM account
options.c: To log in to a website
options.d: To log in to a social media platform
